body.name: Jack of Diamonds: A Mystery Thriller Novel (Detective Jack Stratton Mystery Thriller Series Book 8)
body.description: Getting Married is Murder! All Jack Stratton wants to do is get married to the woman he loves—and make it through the wedding. It seems like he is finally getting his wish until he responds to a police distress call and discovers his old partner unconscious in an abandoned house. Investigators insist it was just an accident, but Jack fears there may be more to it. Sketches of women cover the walls, and among them is one sketch that makes Jack’s blood run cold—a sketch of Alice, pinned up beside an invitation to a very special wedding—his own. Jack finds himself thrown into one of the deadliest cases he’s ever worked. Jack comes to a terrifying conclusion—there’s a serial killer on the loose… and Alice is his next target.As their wedding day looms closer, Jack and Alice must work together to solve the murders and put an end to the killer. Will they catch the psychopath in time, or will their loved ones attend a funeral instead of a wedding? Jack of Diamonds is a riveting thriller that takes murder mysteries to a whole other level. Filled with intrigue and suspense, this book delivers compelling twists and crafty schemes along with some laugh-out-loud wedding antics. As Jack and Alice fight a deadly killer, their long, happy future together seems like it’s just inches from slipping away. This time, “till death do us part” might just be a bit too accurate!Grab your copy and start reading this electrifying novel today!Praise for Jack of Diamonds:Pure entertainment! — Amazon ReviewA fun, edge of your seat thriller! — Audible ReviewSO GOOD! The who done it is a WHODUNNIT! — Amazon ReviewFive Shining Golden Stars! You’ve got to read it! — Dan Santos, AuthorBe prepared to put everything else to the side while holding your breath! — Amazon ReviewFrom multi-award-winning Wall Street Journal bestselling author Christopher Greyson comes this spellbinding tale with jaw-dropping secrets, a colorful ensemble of characters, and a protagonist you’ll root for from the first page to the last.Christopher Greyson's novels have been read by millions of readers. Look for other standalone novels by Wall Street Journal bestselling author Christopher Greyson featuring leading man Detective Jack Stratton. These books can be read in any order.The Detective Jack Stratton Mystery-Thriller SeriesAnd Then She Was Gone (Prequel)Girl JackedJack KnifedJacks Are WildJack and the Giant KillerData JackJack of HeartsJack FrostJack of DiamondsCaptain JackAlso by Christopher Greyson:The Girl Who Lived• Best Mystery-Thriller eBook of the Year — Independent Publisher Book Awards• Winner Best Thriller — National Indie Excellence Awards• Winner Best Thriller — Silver Falchion Award• Finalist eBook Fiction — Indie Book Awards• Silver Medal Suspense — Reader’s Favorite Book Awards One Little LieThe Adventures of Finn & AnniePure of HeartKIKU – The Yakuza War TrilogyA Beautiful Place to Die Kindle the Fires of War Dance of DeathPlease visit ChristopherGreyson.com and get a FREE copy of the exclusive Detective Jack Stratton short story: FIRST PATROL.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Liked it all, no dislikes! Wonderful thriller melted me reading way into the night, had a real hard time putting the book down, so I could sleep.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SO GOOD...I LOVE this series and the who dunit is a WHO DUNIT
reviews.reviewText: I hate a book that I can guess before I am even half way through. Seriously, these books are not like that. You may THINK you figure it out but WRONG...you do not.Jack is a great character. While he has some issues, HE IS NOT SO FLAWED YOU CAN NOT RELATE or like him. I find him interesting and just someone you FEEL FOR.Alice is a gem. She is everything you want a side kick to be WITH ISSUES, but again, NOT to the point you just don't connect with.AND WHO CAN FORGET LADY...the characterization of this dog is so great....The plot is thick and you just think you get a grip and you don't. You think you have it figured out, makes sense, but nope. AND SUCH AN INTRICATE SPIDER'S WEB.So sad I am out of this series now.....read them all and I want more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wish Alice had a more active part in the last few books. In the first few books she was cool then suddenly she turned into a crybaby. It would be more fun if they were an active team with distinct roles since she has hacking abilities. I may read the next novel but I’m getting bored by the way the characters are falling into practicable roles. Jack can still be a hero even with a strong wife. It actually makes him more attractive not less.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
reviews.reviewText: These Jack Stratton series books are so enjoyable. I enjoy the characters and the suspense but the laugh out loud moments are so fun and such a treat. I love the Jack and Alice relationship and adore Lady the dog and her antics. Great group of books. One more to go and I hope it really isn't the last.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kept me guessing!
reviews.reviewText: I have read all of Christopher Greyson's books and enjoyed every one. Jack of Diamonds is another great book. The fact that he doesn't need to include profanity in his writings is a huge plus! Characters are so detailed, it makes you feel as you know them. The suspense makes me want to go to the end of the book just to see who the guilt party is... but I don't!! And I'm always surprised. I would recommend reading all of Christopher Greyson's books. You won't be sorry!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars can it get better?
reviews.reviewText: Yes, yes, yes! I loved the book and I look forward to seeing more. A must read of Jack and Alice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Didn't see THAT coming!
reviews.reviewText: This was a real page turner, true to Greyson's form! I did have a few reservations, though, for the first time in any of his books.First is possibly my own problem. I read a lot, and while I have read all of his books, I have read enough others since his last one came out that not all of his characters and their stories come immediately to mind. While I really liked that they all were included in this book, remembering the background of each played an important part in the plot. It would be confusing for someone who had not read the other books. While I like the continuation, I am disappointed when I read a book that requires following the series.The resolution caught me totally off guard, feeling almost robbed, in a way. I can't really explain without giving anything away, but it was a bit of a disappointment for me.Overall, while I'd like to give it 5 stars, I'm stopping at 4. I do recommend it, and look forward to the next adventure of Jack and Alice!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jack and Alice's wedding one of the best books yet
reviews.reviewText: Jack and Alice are just days away from their wedding when a police distress call turns Jack’s life upside down. His old partner is unconscious in an abandoned house and when Jack sees sketches of women covering the walls and one is Alice and a copy of their wedding invitation you can feel his heart stop beating. Come along for another great installment of the Jack Stratton series and be prepared to put everything else to the side while holding your breath and praying that Jack and Alice will make it to their wedding. This series just keeps getting better and better. A lot happens and to add it to my review would spoil it for the next reader, just know you won’t be disappointed.
Read all Stratton books. Fell in love with the characters. Sometimes the story was too rough to be believed, nevertheless loved all of them

Christopher Greyson delivers an action packed story. Lots of twists and turns to keep you interested and Jack of Diamonds is no exception. I have read every Jack Stratton book and have enjoyed everyone of them. Each books leaves me wanting more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 17, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this, it’s gripping & at times couldn’t put it down & I can highly recommend. Not to sure what to expect in the next instalment now things have changed so much. I really hope they continue to be as good as the previous books. Hope we don’t have to wait to long Jack & Alice are my favourites of them all.

I started reading this morning and could not put it down until I finished it - I can’t wait to read the next book to see if Jack gets back into the Police force - I hope he does - I have every one of the books and love them all - thank you
I guess this was one of the best of his Stratton series. Had me hooked. A good and interesting read.
